event.title: <show-title>Grease 2</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Come act cool, look cool, and drink cool with us
event.description: Calling all Cool Riders! Join us for a Rock-a-Hula-Luau, or as we like to call it, a GREASE 2 Movie Party. Not only will we be showing 1982’s groovy musical tribute to silk jackets, slicked back hair, and totally rad motorcycles, we’ll be giving out a gaggle of goodies to take you all the way back to Rydell High. Whether you’re a T-Bird or a Pink Lady, everyone will get Candy Cigs, A Bowling Ball Keychain, a Lei, and a pair of Sunglasses to complete the look. So break out that hair crimper, grab your best gal, and get ready for some grade A prowlin.

show.title: Halloween III: Season of the Witch
show.headline: Happy, happy Halloween, Silver Shamrock!

event.title: <show-title>Halloween III: Season of the Witch</show-title>
event.headline: The night no one comes home!
event.description:
John Carpenter and Debra Hill never intended for their film HALLOWEEN to become a franchise. When the slasher to end all slashers became a runaway hit, though, the two were tasked with figuring out a way to keep the sequels chugging along. Michael Myers would, of course, return for HALLOWEEN II but it was the third film - HALLOWEEN III: SEASON OF THE WITCH - that gave the filmmakers a chance to do what they deeply wanted to do with the franchise: turn it into an anthology series of unconnected scary movies themed around the spooky holiday. And we blew it.

SEASON OF THE WTICH was a box office and critical bomb when it was first released but the movie has, thankfully, been given the reappraisal it so richly deserves. Tom Atkins stars as a medical doctor who finds himself deep in an investigation surrounding the mysterious death of a novelty gift store owner. As he digs deeper, he begins to discover a vast conspiracy beyond his wildest imagination.

At once both ahead of its time and a fun throwback to the Hammer horror films of the '60s and '70s, SEASON OF THE WITCH is a total blast - a wild genre mash-up that constantly defies audience expectations. Come celebrate the 40th anniversary of this spookfest. I guarantee - you won't even care that Michael Myers is confined to a blink-and-you'll-miss-him cameo.

show.title: Pet Sematary
show.headline: Sometimes dead is better.

event.title: <show-title>Pet Sematary</show-title>
event.headline: Sometimes dead is better.
event.description: Mary Lambert's 1989 adaptation of the Stephen King horror-literature classic stars Dale Midkiff as a veterinarian who, after suffering tragedy in his family, dips his toes into supernatural power he does not fully understand. Creepy kids, creepier animals and Fred Gwynne sporting a beyond-memorable Maine accent - PET SEMATARY is responsible for unleashing waves of nightmare fuel upon an unsuspecting generation of horror hounds. Just a mention of “Zelda” sends a shiver down the spine of those in the know. Don’t miss a chance to see this still spooky creepfest on the big screen via a 4K digital restoration.

show.title: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
show.headline: We'll give you a pair of coconuts (while they last). You'll know what to do.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Monty python and the holy grail still 01

portraitHeroImage.altText: Monty python and the holy grail still 02

posterImages.altText: Monty python and the holy grail poster 01

event.title: <show-title>Monty Python and the Holy Grail</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Just say Ni!
event.description:
Greetings old women, it is I, Arthur, your king!

That's right, one of the greatest and most quotable movies of all time is getting the Movie Party treatment, which means you can get in on all the sword-fighting, coconut-clomping glory.

We'll have swords for everyone, coconut halves for you to bring your imaginary horses to life, onscreen lyrics so that you can sing-along with the Knights of the Round Table, and a test of will, dexterity, and might prior to the show to recruit some brave knights to our cause (don't go second-guessing your favorite colors, now).

So follow, but follow only if ye be men of valor. For the entrance to this Movie Party is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel, that no man yet has fought with it and lived. Bones of full fifty men lie strewn about its lair. So, brave knights, if you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth.

show.title: Pokémon Detective Pikachu
show.headline: Life is real out here in the streets of Ryme City.

event.title: <show-title>Pokémon Detective Pikachu</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: The very best movie party, like no one ever was
event.description: Have you always wanted to head out into a wilderness filled with pocket monsters? Do you have an uncontrollable urge to “catch ‘em all”? Then we’ve got the movie party for you. We’re headed to Ryme City, where Pokémon and humans live in harmony, for a funny and action-packed mystery in POKÉMON DETECTIVE PIKACHU. Trainers who join us on this epic adventure will get fun themed props, including a magnifying glass, a pokémon figure, an Alamo-themed poké ball, and custom pocket monster cards to help you catch ‘em all. Grab your favorite little monster and party with us to discover the power that’s insiiiiiiiide, POKÉMON!

event.title: <show-title>Dynasty 3-D</show-title>
event.headline: The prince of the Emperor is accused of treason and must fight for his life
event.description: When an emperor’s son is accused of treason against the throne, he ends up in a fight for his life against all comers. Directed by Mei-Chun Chang (Revenge of the Shogun Women), this pop-out martial-arts spectacular stars Bobby Ming, Tao-Liang Tan, Kang Chin, David Wei Tang and Ying Bai, who was given an award for Best Supporting Actor at the 1977 Golden Horse Film Festival.

show.title: The Mummy (1999)
show.headline: The sands will rise. The heavens will part. The power will be unleashed.

event.title: <show-title>The Mummy (1999)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Presented by Super Yaki
event.description:
This show is presented with our friends over at Super Yaki, an indie apparel company that has become a cinephile favorite according to Entertainment Weekly. They rule the internet.

We have a soft spot for 1999’s THE MUMMY, with its thrilling action sequences, sweeping romance, goofy sense of humor, exotic locales, and, of course, the pure, unbridled star power of Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. So we’re inviting you to journey with us to Hamunaptra as we celebrate the 20th anniversary of one of our favorite pieces of ’90s popcorn cinema with THE MUMMY Movie Party.

An ancient curse. A supernatural monster. A bumbling librarian. A dude who definitely isn’t Indiana Jones. Join us for a night of grand, old-fashioned adventure.

show.title: Drunken Master
show.headline: Chan-tastic action and lightning fast fighting!

event.title: <show-title>Drunken Master</show-title>
event.headline: Chan-tastic action and lightning fast fighting!
event.description:
Presented in Cantonese with English subtitles

No other world famous actor has broken as many bones for our amusement as Jackie Chan. The clown prince of kung fu, the Buster Keaton of martial arts, the Johnny Knoxville of Hong Kong: call him what you want, but the man is a legend – and DRUNKEN MASTER is one of the movies that cemented his danger god status.

Yuen Woo Ping, himself a veteran martial artist and filmmaker who would go on to be martial arts choreographer on THE MATRIX trilogy, directs Chan in this classic story of real-life legendary Chinese hero Wong Fei-hung. In this story, Hung sets out to master a variation of the unusual "Drunken Boxing" technique: a perfect setup for Chan's acrobatic skills and slapstick sensibilities. Calling upon lifelong training which began in the Peking opera and continued into his first ventures into stuntwork as an extra in Bruce Lee movies, the physically expressive Chan tears through his role with superhuman stamina, keen precisions of movement, and an exceptional sense of rhythm. It's easy to understand why he became an international superstar. He's Chantastic.

show.headline: He's got a secret weapon with a lot of kick

event.title: <show-title>Drunken Master II</show-title>
event.headline: He's got a secret weapon with a lot of kick
event.description:
Presented in Cantonese with English subtitles

Returning home with his father after a shopping expedition, Wong Fei-Hong is unwittingly caught up in the battle between foreigners who wish to export ancient Chinese artifacts and loyalists who don't want the pieces to leave the country. Fei-Hong must fight against the foreigners using his Drunken Boxing style, and overcome his father's antagonism as well.

show.title: Annie (1982)
show.headline: The movie of 'Tomorrow'

event.title: <show-title>Annie (1982)</show-title>
event.headline: The movie of 'Tomorrow'
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Director John Hustion’s adaptation of the wildly popular Broadway play is the kind of film other musicals aspire to be. Fun, endearing, and filled with plenty of toe-tapping numbers, ANNIE is well-deserving of its iconic status.

In the depths of the 1930's, Annie is a fiery young orphan girl living in a miserable orphanage run by the tyrannical Miss Hannigan. Her seemingly hopeless situation changes dramatically when she is selected to spend a short time at the residence of the wealthy munitions industrialist, Oliver Warbucks. She quickly charms the hearts of the household staff and even the seemingly cold-hearted Warbucks, who decides to help Annie find her long lost parents. However, Miss Hannigan, her evil brother, Rooster, and a female accomplice, have other, more nefarious ideas for the red-headed orphan...

show.headline: Something big was leftover

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2 BD

portraitHeroImage.altText: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs 2 BD

posterImages.altText: Cloudy with a chance of meatballs two sp poster

event.title: <show-title>Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs 2</show-title>
event.headline: Something big was leftover
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Flint and the gang are back for a deadly dangerous mission with a good chance of death to stop some seriously wild food. Inventor Flint Lockwood's genius is finally being recognized as he's invited by his idol Chester V to join The Live Corp Company, where the best and brightest inventors in the world create technologies for the betterment of mankind. Everything is great until he discovers that his most infamous machine (which turns water into food) is still operating and is now creating food-animal hybrids – foodimals! Now it’s up to him and his friends to save the world from deliciously deadly tacodiles, shrimpanzees, apple pie-thons, and double bacon cheespiders.

CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS 2 follows up on the hilarious original with an even more wild adventure that your family is sure to eat up. Returning stars Bill Hader, Anna Faris, James Caan, and Andy Samberg are joined by Will Forte, Neil Patrick Harris, Kristen Schaal, and Terry Crews.

show.title: Goosebumps
show.headline: The stories are alive

event.title: <show-title>Goosebumps</show-title>
event.headline: The stories are alive
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

The beloved series of spooky children’s books comes to life in a hilarious and meta big screen debut. Teenager Zach Cooper (Dylan Minnette), upset about moving from a big city to a small town, finds a silver lining when he meets the beautiful girl, Hannah (Odeya Rush), living right next door. But every silver lining has a cloud, and Zach’s comes when he learns that Hannah’s mysterious dad is in fact R.L. Stine (Jack Black), the author of the bestselling Goosebumps series. It was bad enough having a grumpy and seemingly crazy neighbor, but things go from bad to worse when Stine’s monsters start jumping off the page and terrorizing the town.

GOOSEBUMPS brings all your favorite monsters from the books to life on the big screen, and they bring plenty of comedy and adventure along with them.

eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

titleCardImage.altText: Special Event Event Type Title Card

show.title: The Neverending Story
show.headline: Keep the magic alive

event.title: <show-title>The Neverending Story</show-title>
event.headline: Keep the magic alive
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Many of us have aged quite a bit since we first saw THE NEVERENDING STORY, the classic tale of a young boy who gets swept up in an enchanted fantasy novel. Day jobs, mouths to feed, bills to pay… when you’re an adult, it’s hard to make room for magic in your life.

But if we learned one thing from THE NEVERENDING STORY, it’s the importance of keeping magic, wonder, and imagination alive in our hearts and minds, regardless of age.

So take the journey back into Fantasia and re-live the story of Atreyu and his quest to save the realm from an evil force called The Nothing, all told through the eyes of Bastian, a bullied young boy reading along with the story who may be more integral to it than he realizes.

show.title: Rumble Fish
show.headline: No leader can survive becoming a legend.

show.title: Pokémon Detective Pikachu
show.headline: Life is real out here in the streets of Ryme City.

event.title: <show-title>Pokémon Detective Pikachu</show-title>
event.headline: A detective is missing in Ryme City, & it's up to Pikachu to find him
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

Everyone’s favorite electric mouse is back like you’ve never seen him before – in live action. Oh, and instead of following Ash around fighting Team Rocket, he’s a detective. If all of that sounds like gibberish to you, just trust us, it’s awesome.

There’s a mystery afoot in the bustling metropolis of Ryme City, where humans and Pokémon live side-by-side but can’t communicate with each other. Tim’s (Justice Smith, PAPER TOWNS) detective father has gone missing, so he teams up with Detective Pikachu (Ryan Reynolds, DEADPOOL), his father’s pokemon partner. Tim realizes he can actually understand what this Pokémon is saying (and man, he can talk). A friendship is forged, and the two embark on an adventure to find Tim’s father that will bring them up against some of the most fearsome Pokémon imaginable.

POKÉMON DETECTIVE PIKACHU is a rollicking good time, even if you’re unfamiliar with the source material. From a director with a solid track record of family films (Rob Letterman, GOOSEBUMPS), an Oscar-nominated cinematographer (John Mathieson, LOGAN), and a team of hilarious writers (including GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY scribe Nicole Perlman), POKÉMON DETECTIVE PIKACHU is a funny, exciting, and thoroughly original thrill-ride that will delight Pokémon fans and newcomers alike.

show.title: Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
show.headline: Prepare to get served

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs BD

portraitHeroImage.altText: Cloudy With a Chance of Meatballs BD

posterImages.altText: Cloudy with a chance of meatballs ver3 xlg

event.title: <show-title>Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs</show-title>
event.headline: Prepare to get served
event.description:
This show is part of our Kids Camp series – our summer program dedicated to providing affordable family movies for maximum family fun. All tickets are just $5 for everyone – little kids, big kids, and grownup kids.

We don’t know about you, but ice cream falling from the sky sounds pretty awesome to us. That’s exactly how down-on-his-luck Flint Lockwood feels as he creates a mysterious machine that makes clouds rain food to feed the hungry citizens of Chewandswallow. Hailed as a hero at first, Flint must scramble to avert disaster as food of gargantuan proportions rains down. Can he put an end to the wild weather before the town’s goose is cooked?

CLOUDY WITH A CHANCE OF MEATBALLS is one of those movies that is just plain fun from start to finish. It’s whimsical, packed with adventure, and features a fantastic voice cast, including Bill Hader, Anna Faris, Bruce Campbell, James Caan, Andy Samberg, and even Mr. T.

show.title: Ghostbusters (1984)
show.headline: Cross the streams into a spectral-blast of fun

event.title: <show-title>Ghostbusters (1984)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: CLASSIC MOVIE, INTERACTIVE PROPS… MASS HYSTERIA!
event.description:
For 35 years, GHOSTBUSTERS has held a special place in the hearts of moviegoers with its eye-popping special effects, iconic characters, and, of course, its cast of comedy heavyweights led by Bill Murray. So we want to show our love for this beloved blockbuster by throwing an epically spooky Movie Party.

We’ll have a bunch of ghostly goodies to help you get in on the fun, including your very own firehouse bell, some Stay Puft marshmallows, a Smell-Along card, and some glow necklaces you can wave around anytime the Ghostbusters use their proton packs (just don’t cross the streams).

Join us and cheer on Peter, Ray, Egon, and Winston in the fight against the slimy, spooky, supernatural spirits haunting New York City in this hilarious ’80s classic.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.
